result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse J Staab

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:50 PM Defendant Jesse J Staab appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is requesting bond reduction and makes statement. State is opposed.
Court denies motion to modify bond.
Bail/bond hearing on August 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:05 AM Defendant Jesse J Staab appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions defendant regarding non-appearance. Public Defender is still determining whether he is eligible. He wishes to enter a not guilty plea today.
Defendant has filed a bond modification. Attorney Oswald states that victim's rights have not been complied with. Matter will be set for bond modification hearing. Bond is continued at this time.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse J Staab appeared by video, in custody. 
Court goes over the reason for the defendant not having counsel today and states he needs to give his financial information to the public defenders office. Court will call the jail to make sure defendant is able to get his mortgage information so he can finish getting counsel. Defendant is requesting a bond modification.
Court denies the request and bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from defendant re: sentence credit with Court's response
Court denies petition as he needs to apply to Public Defender first
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
3:06 PM Defendant Jesse J Staab appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. He states he is not eligible for a Public Defender. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today.
Cody Strey is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. He is a deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. On 7/10/22, he was dispatched to a location where a man was chasing his family down the road threatening to kill them. He spoke to SMR and she indicated that she and defendant got into a verbal argument and he squeezed her face. When she attempted to call 911, he took her phone away from her. She took her children and fled the house. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. 
Attorney Knaapen asks Court take judicial notice of Wood County case, 13CF387, a prior domestic abuse conviction. Court takes judicial notice.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on July 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
No contact with alleged victim (SMR) or residence. No contact at this time with the children.

2:12 PM Defendant Jesse J Staab appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Transferred to Branch 3 for preliminary hearing.
